prod_name: Under Armour Men's UA Surge 3
title: De lo mejor en calidad/precio
review: El Under Armour Surge 3 es un producto que me ha dejado una buena impresión.Con su diseño elegante y su tecnología de vanguardia, este zapato brinda un nivel de comodidad y rendimiento sin igual.La suela acolchada y la amortiguación reactiva permiten una pisada suave y eficiente, ideal para actividades físicas de alto impacto.demás, su parte superior transpirable y resistente proporciona un ajuste seguro y flexible. Sin embargo, el precio puede ser un obstáculo para algunos consumidores.En general, el Under Armour Surge 3 es una excelente opción para aquellos que buscan calidad y rendimiento en su calzado deportivo, además muy bien de precio.

title: Der eine Schuh, mein perfekter Allrounder
review: Hi,ich kaufe mir diesen Schuh genau einmal pro Jahr neu. Natürlich habe ich auch noch andere für Hochzeiten, Kunden und sonstige Anlässe aber dieser hier ist für mich der beste. Neben dem Tragekomfort kann ich damit auch alle tun, kurz einkaufen, Joggen, Kinder hin und weg bringen. Alles gar kein problem. Schnell reingeschlüpft und bequem einfach tun.Pro:- Sehr Bequem- Im Angebot auch mein Preis/Leistungs SiegerCon:- An der Ferse bricht das Plastik nach ca genau einem Jahr reinschlüpfen in den SchuhFazit:Perfekter Alltagsbegleiter und auch der eine Contra Punkt ist ja im Grunde eigenverschuldet.

prod_name: Under Armour
title: Good little shoes
review: Bought these to jog and walk in. They are a pretty decent pair of shoes. They are lightweight and relatively comfy after you break them in. For the first couple weeks they were hard on my heels. Nothing a couple bandaids or k tape couldn’t fix! Now that they are broken in, they are a dream. They keep your feet nice and cool for hot runs or hot summer days when you’re out walking. I think once mine bite the dust, I will definitely order again! I gave 4 stars because of the rough beginning and because the sizing is a bit off. After reading other reviews and checking out the size chart on the website, I decided to order half size up and I’m glad I did. They do fit a bit small.
date: Reviewed in Australia on 21 October 2023

prod_name: Under Armour
title: Lightweight and comfortable
review: I am extremely impressed with the performance of this trainers.The fit is true to size and the cushioning provides excellent support for my feet during long runs. The grip on the sole is also exceptional, giving me confidence and stability on different terrains.What I love most about these trainers is how lightweight they are. They feel like an extension of my feet, allowing me to focus on my stride and pace without feeling weighed down. The breathability of the materials is also a standout feature, keeping my feet cool and dry even during intense workouts.Overall, I highly recommend these running trainers to anyone who is serious about their fitness goals. They are stylish, comfortable, and most importantly, provide the performance necessary to push yourself to new heights. These trainers have become an essential part of my running routine and I look forward to continuing to use them for many miles to come!
date: Reviewed in Canada on 30 December 2023

prod_name: Under Armour
title: Expectations met
review: It met my expectations.
date: Reviewed in Canada on 1 January 2024

prod_name: Under Armour
title: Form fitting shock absorbing foot heaven
review: I’ve been in the market for new walking shoes for a while now and have tried on at least a dozen pairs before these. It was immediately apparent to me that these were the winning pair.Pros-Light weight but structurally strongThe heel cup is pronounced holding my foot in place nicely even when unlacedGreat shock absorptionMiddle of the road arch support, it neither pushes into my foot nor does it leave my arch floatingThe shoe widens out at the ball of the foot just right to support the sides of my feet without squeezing them.Cons-Basic insole, that’s comfortable but not as padded or advanced as other shoesLow rise ankle socks are a no no with these shoes as the heel cup I enjoy will suck your sock into the shoe and off your heel.All in all, for $40-$55 these are great shoes. They don’t even feel like you’re wearing shoes. The wife likes the look and feel so much she made me order her a woman’s pair of the same shoe. You can’t go wrong with this shoe
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 April 2023

title: Well made but fit a bit small for the size listed.
review: I work in a large greenhouse complex that has concrete floors so I got these running shoes for all the walking around I do in a work day. I normally take a size 11 but knowing that everything I seem to order online these days for clothing fits a bit smaller than usual. I ordered size 11.5 and they just barely fit. They are definitely a little smaller than some of my other size 11 footwear and these are supposed to be .5 bigger. I could have ordered a size 12 and they would have been perfect but the 11.5 will work and after breaking them in they seem to fit a bit better.

prod_name: Under Armour
title: great shoes but sizing has changed over the years
review: I bought a pair of these runners at a bricks & mortar store in size 11.5 a year or two ago and they have been great; comfortable and durable. They are still usable but starting to go so I thought I would order new ones when they were on sale for under 50$ in October 2023. Good deal. Unfortunately, despite receiving size 11.5 again, these shoes were smaller this time. It wasn't just that the old ones had stretched from use, of course they did.  But my toes were crushed into the end of these new shoes, quite uncomfortably so, and there is no way they would fit with wear. The same size was simply smaller now. They felt like a size 11. Perhaps over the years there has been a change in factory or out-sourcing the shoe manufacturing etc...  End result, I had to send them back and they went back to the normal price @ $95.So as other reviews have warned, buy a half size larger than you normally wear.
date: Reviewed in Mexico on 7 December 2023

prod_name: Under Armour
title: Incredibilmente confortevoli e resistenti
review: Ho recentemente acquistato le scarpe da corsa Under Armour Uomo UA Charged Assert 9 e devo dire che sono decisamente impressionato per il prezzo pagato.Queste scarpe combinano comfort, durata e stile in un unico, fantastico pacchetto.Il primo aspetto che colpisce è il design. Non solo sembrano ottime, ma sono anche costruite per durare. Le utilizzo sia in palestra che per correre su strada e la suola in gomma di alta qualità fornisce un'eccellente trazione su diversi tipi di terreno, e l'intersuola Charged Cushioning assorbe gli impatti, rendendo ogni corsa o camminata un'esperienza molto confortevole.Buona la vestibilità. Il sistema di allacciatura personalizzabile consente di ottenere la perfetta aderenza, garantendo al contempo flessibilità. Queste scarpe si adattano perfettamente al piede, minimizzando il rischio di sfregamenti o punti di pressione.Ottimo rapporto prezzo/qualità, raccomando queste scarpe per chi vuole una scarpa da running non da professionisti ma comunque con buone prestazioni.
date: Reviewed in Canada on 19 October 2023

prod_name: THE NORTH FACE Unisex Vault Rucksack
title: Heavy backpack but decent for school
review: I'm a bit biased when it comes to North Face products because I've been using their brand for many years. So, last year I decided to get the North Face Vault backpack for my son in middle school. He liked that it was black and that it had sturdy straps. I'm going to point out the pros and cons:Pros: very sturdy and can put 1 Chromebook (has it's own pocket for laptops/chromebooks), 3 books, and about 3-5 folders/notebooks. Yes, that's a lot for a middle school, but we tested the backpack out putting in as much stuff as possible when we first got it. There are 2 front pockets. One is larger than the other. My son put his pens/pencils, etc. in the smaller pocket. The bigger pocket had his earbud case, calculator, and other small items for his classes. There are 2 side pockets for water bottles. The zippers are easy to grasp all around with 2 separate zipper pulls. The straps are thick and there is a strap you can tie around your waist area for more security and support.Cons: the mesh-style water bottle holders aren't very well sewn. One of them broke after a month. Granted, you are going to constantly take out and put back your water bottles so I thought the holders should have held up for at least one school year, right? The backpack itself is pretty heavy with nothing in it. So, be prepared to carry a very heavy backpack if your child's school doesn't have lockers for them to put their stuff in and they have to carry their books and laptops all day.Overall, this backpack held up well enough for about one year and a half. I did notice some of the seams on the front pockets become looser but that could just be a user issue. The ripped water bottle holders on the side being ripped so easily could have been made with higher quality material or stitching.I think it's a nice looking backpack.  It's not flashy and it has a small North Face logo.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 August 2022

prod_name: THE NORTH FACE Unisex Vault Rucksack

prod_name: THE NORTH FACE Unisex Vault Rucksack
title: Do not like the accessory pocket / second zippered compartment; bag does not stand up
review: This backpack is very sturdy, but not particularly functional.  the main compartment is very good, although the laptop padded sleeve is very tight (ie, best for a 13 inch laptop, tight for a 15, and impossible for a 17).  I have two main complaints, both of which require the return of this product.  First, the second compartment is not full length, and runs only halfway down the pack.  As such, all your accessories (pens, cords, keys, clif bar, etc.) are in the second compartment, and this runs only halfway down.  When you open the zipper to get at stuff, because it is all top-weight (because it does not go all the way down), the second compartment flops down as soon as the zipper is opened.  It is annoying as hell, and makes getting stuff out difficult.  Competitor bags, including the bag this replaced, the Under Armour Hustle, have the compartment go all the way down.  This prevents the flop when you open the zipper.  Second major complaint, but similar, is that the bag will not stand on its own.  So when you bring it to your desk or next to your desk, it will not stand up.  It always wants to fall over.  Competitor bags do not do this.  Because I am using this bag as my mobile professional office, these two items alone make it impossible to use the bag.  This is disappointing, because other features are better than competitors.  Some items that are better:  material construction is better; fabric is more durable; and most importantly, the straps are more comfortable.  But in the end, the functionality is impaired by the second pocket and the failure to be self-standing.  I am returning the item.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 October 2022

title: Nice, but...
review: I wanted a small, rugged bag that could carry a water bottle, phone, snack, and small first aid kit for hikes. I didn't want something worn across the back. Since the lashing appeared to hold a water bottle (and a few reviews mentioned using the lashing for that purpose), I thought this would be the perfect hiking companion. Yes, a water bottle is taller, but yes, a water bottle does fit in the front lashing. The problem is that makes the slip pocket behind the lashing inaccessible. More problematic though, is that it limits how much stuff can fit in the main compartment of the bag. One would pretty much need to remove the water bottle from the front lashing in order to get into the main part of the bag. The bag itself is well made, just not suited for my needs.

title: perfectas como siempre HASTA HACE 2 MESES QUE SE DESINTEGRARON
review: Hará 8 años o más compré unas en un atienda y desde entonces las sigo llevando, mirad si son buenas.Ya no las encuentro y al verla aquí ni me lo pensé.Ahora mi mujer que funde un juego cada 6 mese o 10, tendrá zapatillas BUENAS, pero buenas que sirven para salir a la calle etc (por la suela tan buena y los materiales) durante varios años por lo menos.Así pues calidad precio son las mejores zapatillas que te puedas echar a los pies-----------------------------------------EDITO 2 AÑOS (CASI 3) DESPUÉSSE HAN PERFORADO!las dos zapatillas se les han DESTROZADO las suelas con dos agujeros ENORMESNo sé si son defectuosas o no originales pero las próximas las compro en tienda, que las han vuelto a poner a la venta

prod_name: The North Face Women's Thermoball Traction Mule
title: Worn 1 week.  Peeling away. So sad.
review: I was all ready to do a 5 star review and order the booties.  I wore them 1 week and Northface is peeling off.  They have only been outside twice. We dont have snow.  I am bummed.  As far as the shoe fit, it is fantastic. I am a regular 9 and purchased a 9. I love them and call them my moon shoes. Fair of fair though.  If you pay for quality NORTHFACE, it should be quality.  For the price,  I'm not getting the quality.  I read thousands of reviews and picked these over Sorel, Teva and birkinstock.  Hindsight I may have went with birks.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 November 2023

prod_name: The North Face Women's Thermoball Traction Mule
title: amazing comfortable & affordable for the great quality
review: Most comfortable things I put my feet in. I was comparing this shoe vs the uggs Tasman tsl and I did like the structure of the uggs more but because of the price point I wanted to try these out. I did not expect it go be so soft and keep warm as if there thermal technology. I thought crocs were the most comfortable slip on shoes till I wore these. The only downside which isn’t too much of a problem for me is that the back u can’t just slide into since it’s flimsy so u have to use your finger to slip it on your heel I don’t mind it but comparing it to the Uggs it would be more convenient if the back was more structured. Other than that I’ve been loving the shoes enough to write a review which I normally don’t do I will be for sure purchasing a pair for my grandma :) also another thing I forgot to point out is I am a fan of white shoes but I can never keep them clean but so far since the material is I believe nylon? When I get dirt on it or some scuff it’s easy just go wipe off.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 December 2022

prod_name: The North Face Women's Thermoball Traction Mule
title: Love these shoes
review: I not only wear around the house, but wear on a regular basis in the winter to run errands, etc.  Super comfy, great design.  It's like having a coat on your feet :)  Very stable but normal wear and tear if you don't pull the back portion up on your heel.  Many times I just slide them on like a slide without a back, and that will cause issues over time.  Overall a wonderful buy.  I also purchased several as Christmas gifts for family and friends.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 July 2023

prod_name: The North Face Women's Thermoball Traction Mule
title: SO.Freaking.Comfy.
review: Listen. Did I think I would be the person wearing puffy jacket slippers with a NF logo on them? Surely not. But then a friend posted something on social media right when I was looking for a new pair of house slippers and I found myself clicking buy now for a pair in black.I thought I would be disappointed and return them. I couldn't have been more wrong.The way they keep my feet warm and comfortable makes me want to wear them everywhere. The traction is great on our hardwood floors, and the lining keeps my toes warm in a house where we are too cheap to keep the heat above 65º in the winter. Plus they are easy to slip on/off when going between inside/outside activities.My only complaint is my feet do get a *little* sweaty, but not enough to knock them down to 4 starts.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 January 2023

prod_name: The North Face Women's Thermoball Traction Mule

prod_name: The North Face Women's Thermoball Traction Mule
title: Super tight arch
review: This would be a 5 star slipper if I didn't have to tear out the excessively tight fabric band across the arch, cut some of the quilted material off and find a replacement to hand sew back on. What a huge bother! And I did it twice, because the size 6 ( that I have worn my entire adult life) was way too tight so I bought a size 7. I  do not have super high arches but I'm not flat footed either. The pressure across the tops of my feet was painful and making my toes even colder. No one should have to alter these slippers to keep them from strangling half of their foot.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 May 2021

prod_name: The North Face Women's Thermoball Traction Mule
title: No More Frozen Toes!!
review: These shoes do keep your toes warm.  I stay cold CONSTANTLY. My husband purchased these as a Christmas gift, I guess he was tired of hearing me complain.  They’re my go to for around the house.  Super comfortable.  I am hard on shoes so a month or two in, I had already worn the labeling off inside.  I’m afraid because  I do tend to fair one side that I’ll break the shoe down eventually, it happens with all shoes.  Time will tell to see how long they withstand.  I don’t have to worry about frozen toes though and it’s a good feeling!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 February 2021

prod_name: The North Face Women's Thermoball Traction Mule
title: Lackluster
review: I was really excited about these and prepared to buy a pair for much of my family as Christmas presents. But then I tried them on. The ankle opening was way too tight. I could get them on easily enough, but they remained tight enough to be uncomfortable even after on. You can wear them as a mule, but I don’t want that to be the only comfortable option. Also, while I didn’t expect much in the way of arch support, etc., these had nothing. Knees, etc caved inward immediately- seemingly more than if I was barefoot and to the point I’d be preoccupied about it causing irritation over time. The sole was thinner than anticipated; you’d feel anything/everything you stepped on. They’re cute, and I wish they’d worked out, but there were too many design flaws to justify keeping them.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 December 2021

prod_name: THE NORTH FACE Women's Etip Gloves
title: so close but not quite
review: I have extremely petite hands and have been struggling to find gloves that don't hang off the ends of my fingers.  These gloves fit "like a glove"  - they are the perfect length for my small hands, and the touch screen fingers work better than any other glove I've tried.  HOWEVER, and this is a big deal, the opening for the wrist is so small and has zero stretch, so I can barely get them on at all.  I have to wiggle them over the widest part of my hand and can barely get them on. Once on they are great, so I'm keeping them for now, but I don't know how long I'll be able to deal with that difficulty of getting them on/off.  Hopefully I can deal with it long enough to keep searching for the perfect pair of gloves!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 January 2023

title: Measure and check the chart!

They don’t work well for snow, but light cold and rain will be just fine. So far they’ve held up since the day we bought them.

title: Not nearly wide enough

date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 October 2023

prod_name: THE NORTH FACE Jester Backpack
title: Obnoxiously top-heavy
review: This is a well-constructed backpack that feels high quality. The padding on the back is great, it's breathable, and very comfortable to wear. I liked so much about it, but the top-heaviness made it a total deal breaker. There is one large compartment with a laptop/tablet pocket that's very useful. However, the smaller outer zip pocket only goes halfway down the bag. Which means that if you put too much in it, the bag tips over no matter how you try to lean it against anything. It also makes it difficult to access the large compartment. Also, if the zipper on the large compartment is even slightly open when you have a lot of things in the smaller pocket, the weight of the small pocket opens up the large compartment, resulting in your things spilling all over the place. Additionally, despite having a pocket on either side for water bottles, you can only carry one at a time because the pocket on the other side becomes very small when using one pocket. I'd been using this backpack for a few months for school, so I can't return, but believe me when I say the problems I mentioned here have been a daily irritation, which made me really regret buying it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 19 November 2022

title: Amplia, práctica y cómoda.
review: La mochila es muy amplia, tiene capacidad para una laptop, varios cuadernos, estuches, dos botellas de agua y todo lo que necesites meter en ella. Además tiene compartimentos especiales para bolígrafos y lápices y bolsa más pequeñas para artículos chicos que pudieras perderse con facilidad. Una de mis partes favoritas es el puerto USB de carga que tiene, ya que permite cargar tus dispositivos de manera segura son tener que llevarlos por dentro. Otro punto extra es el llavero especial que tiene para guardar tus llaves, así evitas perderlas en todo el espacio de la mochila.La tela es muy gruesa, impermeable y de la mejor calidad, mientras que el diseño es muy bonito y práctico para llevar en la espalda sin lastimarse por el peso al tener tirantes gruesos con tela antitranspirante que te permiten tener buen soporte. Por el precio, es una verdadera maravilla, llevo usándola 6 meses y está como nueva. Definitivamente de las mejores mochilas que he comprado.
date: Reviewed in Mexico on 14 June 2023

review: I can't love this product enough!1. Super durable material2. Material does not pill up3. Adjustable straps are well made and comfortable4. Straps adjust easily5. The excessive pockets allow for incredible organization for business and travel6. Definitely water resistant. I haven't tried in pouring rain for any length of time though7. prod_name: Tzowla Travel Laptop Backpack,Durable Water Resistant Anti-Theft 50L Extra Large 17.3 Inch with USB Charging Port and Lock Fit Computer Business Bookbag for Women Men College School Gift
title: Perfekter Rucksack
review: Ich habe den Laptoprucksack vor einiger Zeit gekauft und bin absolut begeistert! Die Qualität des Materials ist hervorragend, und die Verarbeitung ist sehr solide. Der Rucksack bietet ausreichend Platz für meinen Laptop, Tablet, Bücher und alle anderen wichtigen Dinge, die ich für die Arbeit oder die Uni benötige. Die vielen Taschen und Fächer machen die Organisation meiner Sachen zum Kinderspiel.Besonders beeindruckt bin ich von der bequemen Polsterung der Schultergurte, die das Tragen des Rucksacks selbst bei schwerer Beladung angenehm macht. Die ergonomische Gestaltung sorgt dafür, dass er gut auf dem Rücken sitzt und nicht ziept oder drückt.Außerdem gefällt mir das schicke, moderne Design des Rucksacks, das sowohl im Büro als auch in der Freizeit gut aussieht. Die robusten Reißverschlüsse und das strapazierfähige Material machen den Rucksack langlebig und zuverlässig.Insgesamt bin ich äußerst zufrieden mit diesem Laptoprucksack. Er erfüllt alle meine Anforderungen und sieht dabei auch noch gut aus. Ich kann ihn uneingeschränkt empfehlen!
date: Reviewed in Germany on 4 September 2023

prod_name: Tzowla Travel Laptop Backpack,Durable Water Resistant Anti-Theft 50L Extra Large 17.3 Inch with USB Charging Port and Lock Fit Computer Business Bookbag for Women Men College School Gift
title: Sehr guter, kompakter Businessrucksack
review: Ich hatte zuerst auf Amazon Empfehlung einen Rollrucksack eines Startups gekauft.Da dieser sehr schwer und ein großer, für meine Begriffe unübersichtlicher Sack war, ging dieser zurück und habe mir diesen, preislich sehr attraktiven Rucksack gekauft.Die Verarbeitung ist sehr gut, der Rucksack wiegt 800g, ist mit vielen Fächern und Reißverschlussabteilen sehr gut organisiert und das 12" Laptop als auch eine DIN A4 Mappe passen großzügig rein.Der Rucksack lässt sich sehr gut, kaum merkbar tragen.Ich bin bei diesem Preis sehr überrascht und begeistert und hätte für diese Qualität durchaus mehr gezahlt.
date: Reviewed in Germany on 4 September 2023
